travelingsalespersonproblem

Class Heap

  • java.lang.Object
    • travelingsalespersonproblem.Heap

  • public class Heap
extends java.lang.Object
    Heap class that contains an array of Node. This is a Min binary heap stored as an array where the first non-empty node in the heap is the smallest node in the heap and the parent node is larger than its left and right child node.
    Since:
    11/04/2015

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Heap(int n)
      create a heap of size N in in private array h[] of length N+1 with h[0] unused and heap in h[1] through h[N]

      • Heap

        public Heap(int n)
        create a heap of size N in in private array h[] of length N+1 with h[0] unused and heap in h[1] through h[N]

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Node d)
        pre: Node d cannot be empty. h[0] unused and use heap in h[1] through h[N]. Add a new Node to the heap.
        Parameters:
        d - the new Node d to be added.

      • deleteMin

        public int deleteMin()
        delete the min node,i.e. the root node starts with index 1 from the heap. Exchange the min node with the last node in the heap, delete the last node after the exchange and make changes if after deletion it violates the heap's definition. Pre: the heap is not empty.
        Returns:
        the label value of the delete node.

      • update

        public void update(int v,
          double value)
        update the distance value of a node with label v.
        Parameters:
        v - the label value used to find the node to be updated.
        value - the new value to be set for the node.

      • numOfElement

        public int numOfElement()
        get number of existing nodes in the heap.
        Returns:
        number of element in the heap.

      • size

        public int size()
        get size of the heap.
        Returns:
        size of the heap.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        check if the heap is empty.
        Returns:
        true if the heap has no element and false if not.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int v)
        check if the heap contains a node with label v
        Parameters:
        v - the label of the node
        Returns:
        true if the heap contains a node with label v and false if not.

      • printHeap

        public void printHeap()
        print the heap result.
